ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I feel this course would benefit greatly from being split into two parts. One day a week for lecture on the statistical theory behind each section, and the second day strictly used for practicing the use of the R program.
1. Gregoire too unspecific I look at this and I think instead I look at A and it tells me B2. there should be more systematic way to teach the course

Overall the course itself is about information that is useful to know. I've taken a few different statistics class and seeing as I don't personally have a huge interest in statistics, I've always found these classes to be a bit dry. This one was no exception, but the bottom line is that all the materials and R code are available for you to go over and learn at whatever pace you choose throughout the semester.

This is an excellent class, and will deepen your understanding of both statistical mathematics and practice. Its biggest weakness in the year I took it was its comparatively slow start. I would suggest that students be gotten up to speed in R with independent programming-focused work {labs and/or a first assignment, perhaps using concepts from previous statistics classes which they are likely familiar with}. Class time could then be spent on analysis rather than stepping through code.This approach, if it worked, would let the true strengths of the class--Professor Gregoire's experience with and insight into the subject--shine through.The R code could also be cleaner in some cases.
Learning how to do regression with my own data.
A clearer understanding of the concepts in regression analysis
I learned to use R program that is very helpful tool for statistics.
The assignments and the final project. As they both helped to apply what was been in class to real data. It becomes more meaningful once its applied.
the breadth of instruction
The last couple assignments were really useful. The final project also brought things together for me.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: A constantly present TA would have been useful

I believe a TA on campus would be helpful in this course. Additional either lab or special sessions to work through R syntax would be helpful- escpcially for people who have had no computer programming experience. It would also be good to have a special session or lesson on reading results of R and the wording used to describe the fit of a model.
The TA must be in New Haven because R is complicated program that need constant help even though TA had very good disposition to help.
textbook is horrible

While I appreciated the fact that the assignments did not take so much time that I felt my time was wasted, I think that more frequent assignments that dealt specifically with the topics we were studying in a given week would have solidified my understanding of the topics as they came up, rather than rushing to understand them at the end. A little bit more of a defined course map at the beginning would have been helpful as well.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: They were both moderately helpful and the instructor was very responsive.
TA was out of country and usually replied to emails. when in the country he was very helpful. I did not seek help from the instructor or TA as much as I should have
Professor had very good availability and quality to help, however the TA was more difficult because he was not in New Haven.
Both instructor and TF were both very helpful.
homeworks never returned even remotely on time  which was unfortunate because we need the answers before we can progress in other sections

I never got any feedback on my assignments, only the score. I took that to mean that I wasn't doing anything particularly wrong, but I can't honestly say that I think what I turned in was perfect and it would be nice to know where I had made mistakes.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course will provide me with data analysis skills that I can use on my own data.
another computational method to use in research and interpretation of scientific literature
This is a great class for anyone collecting data on natural resource management or biophysical plant or animal data
Its very useful as it helps in the analysis of data, which is forever a big part where forest resources management is concerned.
I need to know this information at some point. It would have been great if I'd had my own data to work with, but it's good to know what I will need to do in the future.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to learn regression modeling.
Academic interests
Applicable to my field
To help me with my summer research and also in my future work analyzing data.
Recommended by my advisor.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, it was not the most exciting course, but I think I've got a decent handle on regression basics now.
yes
Somewhat - I had hoped to learn more about interpreting results and felt that the course covered how to get results, but not enough on how to read the results and word the interpretation
Yes it did
It was no more or less interesting than I have found any stat class to be, though it often felt like we were discussing theory more than might have been necessary.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
yes
somewhat - same as #17
Yes I did
I will definitely not remember everything, but being exposed to it once will help me relearn it in the future.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Its a dry, but important subject
Spend time on each R script after each class - be prepared for a lot of reading and time on the computer working with the R program
Very helpful course. The final project is a power work to apply all the knowledge learned during the course.
To practice more and to take all assignments seriously.
This class will not blow your mind, but it's important to know.
